pkgmetadata.longdescription: .. image:: https://travis-ci.org/crdoconnor/xeger.svg?branch=master :target: https://travis-ci.org/crdoconnor/xegerXeger=====Library to generate random strings from regular expressions.To install, type::: pip install xegerTo use, type:>>> from xeger import Xeger>>> x = Xeger(limit=10) # default limit = 10>>> x.xeger("/json/([0-9]+)")u'/json/15062213'About=====Code borrowed and cleaned up from `the python modulerstr by Leap Frog Development <http://jpmens.net/2010/04/26/resty/>`,in turn inspired by the Java library `Xeger <http://code.google.com/p/xeger/>`.
